column4: grub doesn't display an entry that's in boot.cfg but does display all other boot.cfg entries correctly
Any thoughts anyone?
Been battling this for a couple of hours now
boot.cfg? You mean grub.cfg?
i noticed a similer thing with some iso files i was trying to boot.. but havent looked into it lately
Ah - I figure I have some parameter wrong...But without error messages or logging it's difficult to sort out
not sure what to check really.
i wonder if grub is seeing some mistake and thus ignoring the entry
Yeah - Question is what's the mistake?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/376004/
whats that all for? :)
Output of all the various grub related configs hd settings etc
that the one missing some entries?
Not that I know of?
then whats the problem? :)
The "Windows 7" entry doesn't show up at boot time
ive heard of others with that issue..   but never seen a fix.  Perhaps the forum may have an suggestion
so its shown in grub.cfg but not in the actual grub menu?
Yes
ive never had the issue so never looked into it. I think others have had the issue in her befor. but ive never seen a fix.
i keep my windows and linux on their own hd's so iu can always set the bios to boot the windows drive directly
This is a friends laptop I usually just use VMs myself
thanks for your help
ive seen it mentioned in here. so theres proberly 100 threads on it in the forums.
